name: Savoy Sharm El Sheikh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a chill-out week in April. The location is ideal - just 10 minutes by taxi from the airport, although only about a quarter of a mile as the crow flies! Nevertheless there is no disturbance from the planes. Make sure you haggle with the taxi driver - he tried to charge us £25 to start with, which we got down to £10 and on our return journey, with some help from a local, we paid £6.
reviews.title: Great breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The facilities are good - there is a quite large beach and plenty of sunbeds there and at the pool. Our standard room had everything you needed, including bathrobes, tea and coffee etc. and an evening service when the bathroom was cleaned again, beds turned down and little chocolates left for us.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, we loved it

likes.disliked: — Room being cleaned at 4pm in the afternoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were mostly very good, especially the long suffering guest relations person, who seemed to have the hardest job of the lot - plenty of people seemed to have something to complain about, including us - see below...
reviews.title: i 100 percent recommend this hotel

likes.liked: — the location and the facilities on the resort
likes.disliked: — the walking distance from rooms to pool or beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went B&B, although most guests seemed to be on all inclusive terms and we felt we were made to feel second class, although our view was that as we got to select from full menus instead of a limited choice, and could buy better wine by the bottle, instead of just by the glass, ours was a better deal unless you really wanted to over indulge!
reviews.title: Excellent Service at the Savoy.

likes.liked: — Food and service. And Safari Bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was excellent, with lots of choice aimed at the different nationalities staying there - mainly Brits and Russians. There were several restaurants of varying standards. The main one was self service buffet style and felt a bit like a feeeding station rather than a dining expereince in the evenings. The a la carte restaurants were better, especially the Italian one, but for all these you needed to book. Bookings were only taken between 1pm and 5pm, although when we first arrived , we were not told of this, and ended up having to complain to the deputy general manager before we could get a meal on the first night! They were quite rigid about the booking system and we saw people turned away from restaurants with plenty of empty tables, because they hadn't booked.
reviews.title: Fantasic time

likes.liked: — Terrace bar off the Safari bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: With friends we stayed in this wonderful place, The Savoy in Sharm el Sheikh. It is really a kind of paradise. Beautiful pools, palm trees, fine beach beds, fantastic weather and very kind people (read staff). They do everything to please you.
reviews.title: We enjoyed every minute of it !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and have everything you need and expect. The bed is fine and you can choose from different pillows.
reviews.title: Relaxing hotel in an idilic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To get in Sharm el Sheikh we flew with Egyptair. The airport is modern and the The Savoy is only a few minutes away.
reviews.title: Hotel Staff are Icing on the Cake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In The Savoy we upgraded ourselves tot S-Class. It allowed us to have lunch and dinner in 12 different first class restaurants. We really enjoyed the food and atmosphere in every restaurant that we have chosen. The S-Class gives you vouchers for massages, aqua sports, laundry, bowling, etc. We went to Culturama in Soho Square and witnessed the history of Egypt. In 45 minutes you will understand more about a lot of things you probably don’t know for sure.
reviews.title: This hotel is superb...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, what we try to say : to spend your holiday in The Savoy is relaxing and enjoyable. We will never forget this experience!
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve just returned from 2 weeks staying in the Royal Savoy. This was our first trip to Egypt as we usually go to Dubai, but wanted a holiday without building works – and we weren’t disappointed!
reviews.title: Royal Savoy Hotel

likes.liked: — Large Spacious Royal Rooms with direct access to the Royal Swimming Pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Savoy is a large hotel complex, 15 mins from Sharm Airport. It has a beach front location although the beach is a little small with a great number of sunbeds and umbrellas. The best things about the beach are the 2 pontoons which stretch out over the Coral. This is a great place to go snorkeling, or for those who don’t like the water, the fish are clearly visible from the pontoon.
reviews.title: Amazing Week At The Savoy

likes.liked: — Luxurious surroundings, amazing pools, great service
likes.disliked: — I can't afford to live there permanently

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach Bar is great for afternoon snacks (burgers, hot dogs, chips etc) they also have Ice creams available – which is a saving grace in the heat of the day.
reviews.title: Lazy is GOOD

likes.disliked: — The bartenders at the pool and the watersports centre where they rip you off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have stated, I would recommend that you go all inclusive if your budget will stretch. It does make a world of difference and entitles you to eat at all of the restaurants, both on the complex and those within SOHO Square opposite the Hotel. The food in all the restaurants is excellent (although I cannot comment on the Tirana, buffet Restaurant). Our favorite restaurants were Morgana’s and Zen the Chinese in SOHO Square.
reviews.title: Stay All Inclusive or pay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to get booked into the Royal Savoy, which gave you a few more privileges than the main hotel. You have your own swimming pools which can only be used by the Royal guests. One deep pool and one shallow pool for the children (or those sunbathers who like to have their sunbeds in the water!).
reviews.title: Great resort, fantastic food and very hot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived Christmas Day 2007 that it myself, husband and 2 daughters not having been away for Xmas before we was all a little unsure if we had done the right thing, we had I am pleased to say and we had a wonderful welcome on arrival, with bell ringers in Xmas attire.
reviews.title: Loved the Savoy!

likes.disliked: — The booking system for the restaurant if you are all inclusive that is.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our stay was for 2 weeks and our room was perfect (room 7016) if you have children this is a great area to be based as there is the children's pool, trampoline and the kids club (which is free) the girls loved it in there and where free to come and go as they pleased.
reviews.title: Value For Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was nice, full of Russians I must admit and the service could have been better but the hotel was nice and clean, the room where spacious and had sky TV with limited channels but we managed to see a film most nights.
reviews.title: Loved Royal Savoy

likes.disliked: — Food at the free buffet (don't bother going there)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loads of restaurants fish, italian etc etc.
reviews.title: Take my advice, Upgrade to the Royal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pools are lovely, look fab and heated (not the very large main pool though) beach is superb with waiter service and a dipping pool which is great.
reviews.title: The honest overall review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Savoy basically occupies its own resort! The hotel is large and has 3 great pools and its own beach.
reviews.title: Got to be one of the best in Sharm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I dont think you could get much better than this.
reviews.title: Don't Hesitate - Great Hotel - Great Service - Will Return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were pretty good, we had a double pool view on the same level as the pool..nothing too flashy, just a clean room with a comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Not the typical resort-exceeded our expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would have liked to stay one floor up for a better view but there wasnt availability and the staff all thought we were mad as our room was one of the more popular having a seating area outside near the pool.
reviews.title: definitely the best place to stay in Sharm El Sheikh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They didnt have some of the normal 5 star touches like flowers in the toilet or chocolates on the pillows but not too fussed about that.
reviews.title: Extraordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and me returned from Savoy 20 Apr 08. In general we like this hotel. The staff were great and courteous. The territory were wonderful. The room was spacious and nice but not 5 stars (a little bit old furniture i have to sad).
reviews.title: Everything was OK! But there were rough management mistakes at the end

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food in A La carte restaurant were great, especially in Italian restaurant! But the main restraunt was dull and monotonous in food. The qualitty of meat in main restraunt was bad, as meat was rubber on taste.(((
reviews.title: Royal Savoy - dream come true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: By the end of our vacation we were very disappointed by management of Savoy concerning check out from the hotel. We had very late flight to Moscow at 11.30 p.m. in night, so we liked to prolong for additional money our staying in room at least by 18.00 p.m. We asked receptionist about prolonging from the fist day of our vacation, they answered us come at morning on the last day, but on the last day of vacation they said to us "STRONG NO". We were surprised.
reviews.title: Let Down by the Food and Beverage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So my wife and me had to stay more than 8 hours on the sofa in Lobby. NO free food for S-class after 12.00 a.m. NO free drinks after 12.00 a.m - everything for great additional money and staying the hole day at sofa!!! I have been in many countries around the world and never seen so abominable relation for guests after check out!!! I think they had to provide us by S-class food and drinks till evening as they failed with room prlonging of staying.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

likes.disliked: — The Russians.but they are like a rash

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SO I HAVE TO ASK you dear travelers - IS THIS FIVE STARS CHECK OUT??? And i have to ask you definitely NO!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, shame about the rooms.

likes.disliked: — The standard of the rooms and the bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having returned from the Savoy Sharm el Sheik i can safely say this was one of the best holidays i have ever had.
reviews.title: unquestionable class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The attention to detail was exceptional and the staff were all very attentive and helpful.
reviews.title: Very safe holiday with some great service standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: One phone call to reception and a small problem with our toilet was sorted very quickly.
reviews.title: Bad is not enough.. i wonder those guys who said it is great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We apid extra for a sea view room but only went out on the balcony a couple of times as the area around the pool was beautiful and kept to a very high standard.
reviews.title: Dont go there !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: There was never a problem getting a sun lounger so need to rush down with a towel to secure your place.
reviews.title: Very Very ill because of this hotel, along with at least 20 others!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, good food and above all excellent beach with beautiful corals.
reviews.title: Try the mango juice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Savoy is beautiful, the reception, restaurants, public areas, swimming pools, beach, staff and service are all a definite five star. The only thing that let it down slightly was the room/bathroom, which if we were really picky could do with a revamp. The balcony, however, is huge with a full set of conservatory furniture. We had a pool/sea view room and spent early evening, drink in hand, taking in the wonderful view before we ventured out.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and be looked after.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed bed and breakfast and weren't sure we were doing the right thing before we left but I would recommend it. Breakfast was help yourself to as much or as little as you like with a huge choice, hot and cold. Lunch was available in many of the restaurants or delivered to your sun lounger on the beach, if you are feeling very lazy like me. Pizza and soft drinks on the beach costs 65 egyptian, exactly the same price as if you trundled up to the restaurant overlooking the beach. We found all the meal prices to be very good value and everything is charged to your room to be paid at the end of the holiday, which is so convenient. Our total bill, two people, lunch and dinner, with soft drinks only for one week was £340. Amazing and we eat sooo well. The all inclusive option would have cost us so much more and I think perhaps you would only benefit if you are huge drinkers. We took duty free and had a glass or two on the balcony. There are a total of twelve restaurants to choose from including the ones in Soho square and as a bed and breakfast customer you get 35% discount in five of them, including the Hot Rock, which is fantastic.
reviews.title: just AMAZING.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fact that the hotel has its own reef is such a bonus, and the snorkeling is amazing. You can't walk out into the water to swim, you have to use the pontoon to protect the coral, but you can sit in the shallows if all you want is a dip to cool off. The beach boys are great and always find you the perfect spot no matter what time you get to the beach. There are huge umbrellas with plenty of shade if you want it. There is excavation work going on to the right of the beach facing the water, but it only disturbed us one day and we just asked to moved down to the other end of the beach where we could barely hear it.
reviews.title: 5* all the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a wonderful place, with friendly and courteous staff. A lovely relaxing week in great surroundings.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the construction work next door...

aka: The Savoy Sharm El Sheikh Hotel
description: The Savoy Sharm El Sheikh offers its guests more accommodation options than ever before. In addition to the beautiful hotel and surroundings, we also present the Royal Savoy and the Savoy Villas. The Royal Savoy is an exclusive category of accommodation: a self-contained 'Club' wing, with impeccable style and services that redefine the meaning of luxury. The Royal has its own private lounge, pool and beach area.
